casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America v. James Joseph HAMMERLE, Appellant. No. 13546. United States Court of Appeals Third Circuit. Argued May 26, 1961. Decided July 7, 1961. F. Neal Sever, Pittsburgh, Pa., for appellant. W. Wendell Stanton, Asst. U. S. Atty., Pittsburgh, Pa. (Hubert I. Teitelbaum, U. S. Atty., Pittsburgh, Pa., on the brief), for appellee.

Before BIGGS, Chief Judge, and Mc-LAUGHLIN arid KALODNER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.'

We have reviewed the record presented on this appeal and we can perceive no substantial error in it. The judgment will be affirmed.
